alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 5:23AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Patchy Fog This Morning... Area observations and traffic cameras show fog has developed over interior northeast North Carolina and portions of central and south central Virginia south of Interstate 64. Visibilities less than one mile will be common, with occasional visibility reductions to one quarter to one half mile also possible. The fog will tend to be thickest in rural and sheltered locations, but could become locally dense at times for most of the area. Conditions should gradually improve after sunrise. Motorists should be alert for sudden changes in visibility due to the areas of dense fog. Drive at reduced speeds, increase following distance, and use low beam headlights only.
